title: Allow users with the developer role to create app packages in Visual Studio
body: It's great that the Dev Center now allows multiple users to access the same account, and I can submit app packages as a user with the developer role: https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt489008.aspx.

comments.body: Yes. This features enables developer to associate the app with the store and to have "Release" build definition for the app and the build output generates the appxupload file that can be published to store directly.

before you get all disappointed. There is an alternative to upload the package to the store.
https://blogs.windows.com/buildingapps/2015/12/15/building-an-app-for-a-3rd-party-how-to-package-their-store-app/
You do not have the full visual studio integration experience, but that shouldn't block you.
I can't believe this is not the case. whats the point of a dev account that can't create packages
Would just be better to allow other MS accounts to have access to the developer role...

With the current situation it's still like "Currently, all these people need to share the same live-id which is totally impractical as it can be a personal live id of a manager and he is not willing to share it with others. It would be really nice if access can be given to other live ids as well!" as in this related issue: https://wpdev.uservoice.com/forums/110705-universal-windows-platform/suggestions/3820213-allow-multiple-microsoft-accounts-to-manage-a-dev
All my excitement went away as I encountered this same issue today :(
This issue also means devs cannot create local appx packages for enterprise code signing this, as these can only be created in VS with the developer account associated.

It would be nice if after the tests are passed, one could upload the appx file directly from the IDE instead of opening a browser and doing so using the web interface. Also, handling updates, creating releases could be much more seamless.
